item.title: Best Open-World Games That Make You Think, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • High-quality video games challenge players intellectually and emotionally, offering a variety of experiences beyond mindless entertainment.
  • Open-world games like RDR2, The Witcher 3, and Horizon Forbidden West reward attentive and thoughtful players with deep storytelling.
  • Games like Elden Ring, The Witness, and Fallout: New Vegas require players to think strategically, reflect on themes, and make tough decisions.

Many detractors of the industry call video games mindless entertainment, but there are a lot of high-quality titles out there that don't fit that description at all. As video games have evolved, developers have found new ways to challenge players, be it through intellect or emotion. There are many games that let players turn off their brains and unwind, but there are just as many that keep them on their mental toes.

The open-world genre is full of titles like this. Wide, nonlinear worlds often challenge players to forge their own path and make their own decisions in a world that fights against them at every turn. These games reward attentive and thoughtful players who are willing to meditate on what a game requires of them.

10 Red Dead Redemption 2

A Sweeping Tragedy

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
168
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Powered by

Rockstar's epic Western tragedy centers around the downfall of the Van Der Linde Gang, a close-knit band of outlaws who fracture and fall apart under the stress of struggling to survive in the Western frontier. Despite the vast scope of the game, RDR2 's writers keep the story personal and extremely moving.

By the time the credits roll on Arthur Morgan's tale, players will have been given a lot to think about. The doomed quest of the Van Der Lindes makes players question everything from their sense of right and wrong to their ideals of justice. They'll also have ample opportunity to reflect on the inevitability of death and the inherent value of life.

9 The Witcher 3

A Carefully Choreographed Hunt

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

The Witcher 3 submerges players in a complex world of political intrigue and war, with monsters lurking in the shadows around every corner. Protagonist Geralt's role as a Witcher puts him on the front lines of defending humanity from the creatures that threaten them. Each encounter is a complex hunt, requiring players to plan ahead when choosing gear and mutagens.

On top of the strategic requirements of monster hunting, multiple quests require difficult choices as well. The Witcher 3 's Continent is a realm of deep moral ambiguity, where very little is as it seems. The decisions Geralt must make will often have deep, far-reaching consequences, and players should never take any of them for granted.

8 Horizon Forbidden West

Technical Teardowns

Horizon Forbidden West
9 /10
37
8.6 /10
Released
February 18, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Guerrilla Games
Powered by

The Horizon franchise is best known for its tremendous robotic beasts, and Forbidden West delivers richly on this front. These dangerous creatures can be challenging to engage in combat, especially in groups. Players must learn to approach every encounter carefully and strategically, targeting weak spots and disabling weapons whenever possible.

The story of the game also offers plenty of material for deep reflection. Like its predecessor, Horizon Forbidden West is concerned with themes of posthumanism, artificial intelligence, and the costs and demands of perpetuating humanity in the post-apocalypse. These are weighty themes, and ones players will be thinking about long after the credits have rolled.

7 Cyberpunk 2077

Staying Alive In Night City

6 Images
6 Images
Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
113
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 is based not only on the tabletop RPG Cyberpunk RED , but on a genre of speculative fiction stretching back decades. The Cyberpunk genre deals with burning questions about the danger of corporate overreach and its insidious role in the advancement of technology. These troubling themes are brought to life in Cyberpunk 2077 's dystopic iteration of Night City, where injustice and tragedy can be seen around every corner.

Many of the sidequests V undertakes in their race to save themselves from the malfunctioning computer chip in their skull challenge the character's preconceived notions of life in Night City. They will leave the player with questions about the nature of society, the human cost of modern pop culture, and the risks of unchecked technological progress.

6 Elden Ring

A Struggle For Survival

6 Images
6 Images
Elden Ring
10 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
From Software
Powered by

Elden Ring is not a game players can stroll through without effort. If players don't pay close attention to enemy placements, movesets, and dungeon layouts, they will not succeed. The game boasts some of FromSoftware's most punishing bosses yet, and fans who don't study these foes for weaknesses to exploit and risks to punish will not prevail.

It's also a struggle for fans who are interested in learning Elden Ring 's lore. The game is not straightforward in any respect, and players who want to learn more about the history of the game will have their work cut out for them, studying item descriptions and cryptic lines of dialogue in order to piece together the story. While a casual observer might look at Elden Ring and see nothing but sweeping boss fights and violent combat, it is in every respect a deeply cerebral game.

5 Death Stranding 2

Taking A Walk

24 Images
24 Images
Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
17
9.1 /10
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Powered by

The original Death Stranding was a divisive game, infamous for its slow and methodical gameplay and for its avant-garde approach to storytelling. Death Stranding 2 has made considerable improvements to its predecessor's gameplay, making it more engaging for fans to explore and experiment with the various traversal tools on offer.

This also makes it easier for players to focus on the story. While creator Hideo Kojima is notorious for his bizarre stories, convoluted plot twists, and outlandish character designs, he's also well-known for discussing serious and heavy topics. Death Stranding 2 , which was reworked to touch on the effects of the COVID-19 pandemic, is no different. It offers players a deep meditation on the cost of keeping communities connected in the face of overwhelming tragedy.

4 Shadow of the Colossus

The Harder They Fall

Shadow of the Colossus (2018)
8.9 /10
Released
February 6, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood, Violence
Developer(s)
Bluepoint Games, JapanStudio, Team Ico
Powered by

Shadow of the Colossus bucks many of the trends that usually define an open-world game. While the game's map is expansive, it's almost entirely empty of creatures, dungeons, and treasures. Instead, players must track down 16 massive colossi, majestic beasts who must be slain in order to resurrect a mysterious princess.

While the combat itself has earned the game exceptional praise, the thing that really makes Shadow of the Colossus stand out is its grim, reflective tone and subject matter. The long stretches of wandering alone through the game's world give players ample time to reflect on their violent deeds and the cost of their character's devotion.

3 The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom

Building A Better Bridge

The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom
60
9.2 /10
Released
May 12, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Rated E for Everyone 10+ for Fantasy Violence and Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo
Powered by

Tears of the Kingdom iterated on its predecessor in a staggering number of ways. Its expanded world boasts countless new opportunities for exploration and puzzle-solving, and the new powers at Link's disposal give him nearly infinite options. The Fuse and Ultrahand abilities allow players to cobble together ad-hoc solutions to any problem they face, be it a challenging environmental puzzle or a powerful monster.

The moment-to-moment combat remains as fluid and reactive as ever, but the introduction of new fusion options for weapons adds considerable depth. Players can assemble a collection of unique and distinct weaponry, giving them an option for every enemy encounter, no matter how outlandish. If fans plan ahead and take time to think through their constructs, they can truly take Hyrule by storm.

2 The Witness

Figuring It Out

The Witness
10 /10
8.6 /10
Released
January 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Alcohol Reference
Developer(s)
Thekla Inc.
Powered by

The Witness isn't what most people picture when they think of an open-world game. This mysterious game takes place on a small island, which surrounds players with countless line puzzles and no clear guidance on how to solve them. Fans must explore their surroundings for clues not only about how to solve the puzzles, but how the puzzles actually work, deepening the mystery at every turn.

The game's eerily tranquil setting and atmosphere were inspired by Myst , one of the most foundational puzzle games out there. The Witness proves itself an excellent successor in terms of mystery, intrigue, and challenge. Gamers will have to pay close attention to their surroundings if they want to discover the island's many secrets.

1 Fallout: New Vegas

Playing For Keeps

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas depicts a tense, multilayered political struggle in a region rife with conflict. As players wander the desert in pursuit of the man who shot them in the head, they'll find themselves inexorably drawn into the brewing war for control of the Mojave, and into the lives of the people who call it home.

The world of Fallout: New Vegas is complex and reactive. There are conflicts large and small throughout the region, and solving problems is rarely as simple as killing some random lizards. Players will have to make difficult decisions with severe ramifications and without an objectively right answer. Succeeding in Fallout: New Vegas requires thinking carefully about what the best solution is in a sea of bad options.

item.title: Grow A Garden: All Mutations (& How to Get Them)
item.description:
In Roblox s Grow A Garden , you get to take care of your own digital garden, where fruits can grow massive and show off unique patterns and designs. While checking out your garden (or visiting your neighbor's), you might have spotted fruits that look a bit different. Some are dripping water, some are frozen solid, and some have shiny stars sparkling around them.

These are called mutations, and every Grow A Garden player should know about them. Theyre a big part of what can turn you into a millionaire (or even a billionaire) in this cute botanical sim. So, if you're wondering what each mutation does and how to get them on your crops, this guide has got you covered.

Updated by Somiya Adrees on August 18, 2025: In this article, youll find the value of all mutations added up to the 1.19.0 update. This also includes the event variants, as players can still trigger some of them using tools and pets by trading with others.

How to Get Mutations in Grow a Garden

Mutations are basically cool changes that happen to your plants. Some depend on weather events, while others can be activated by using tools, setups, or special variant seeds. They not only make your garden look way more colorful and shiny, but also help you get rich real quick.

Getting mutations on your fruits and veggies can seriously boost their selling price. Below is a list of all the mutations in the game, how much each one sells for, and easy ways to grow them faster.

All Mutations

Sell Value

How to Get Them

Big

1x Value (but it can increase with the fruits weight)

Place sprinklers near your fruits; each one is available at the Gear Shop. The mutation can kick in at any time , but only a small patch of nearby fruits will grow bigger. Its a great way to earn money if the fruit already has other mutations on it or if youre testing the sprinkler glitch to make it massive.

Ripe

1x Value

Each in-game day, there's a chance a Sugar Apple will mutate on its own and change in appearance. This variant only applies to Sugar Apples and doesnt affect their selling value.

Wet

2x Value

Wait for rainy weather (it usually shows up every 10 to 15 minutes), and let your crops soak. Rain can bless all your harvests, but there's only about a 50% chance they'll get the Wet mutation. You can also use Mutation Spray Wet to snag these kinds of plants.

Chilled

2x Value

This one sparks in frost weather , which can randomly pop up on the server. Just keep an eye on your crops while the weather is active; theres a good chance theyll pick it up on their own. Players can also use the Chilled Mutation Spray or a Polar Bear to force the Chilled Mutation on their plants.

Moonlit

2x Value

This mutation can occur automatically on some of your plants during a Night Event . Placing a Night Staff in your garden can help trigger it faster.

Windstruck

2x Value

During the Windy or Gale weather , strong gusts may trigger the Windstruck mutation on your plants. A pet with the Windy mutation or a Mutation Spray Windstruck can also do this.

Chocolate

2x Value

Set a Chocolate Sprinkler next to your seeds or plants, or use the Mutation Spray Choc to start collecting chocolate fruits as they ripen. You can also wait for Chocolate Rain to get this variant.

Sandy

3x Value

When theres a Sandstorm Weather on the server (it happens naturally), the dust floating around will turn your fruits Sandy. Plus, a Jackalope pet can now apply this mutation too.

Pollinated

3x Value

Let the Bee Swarm event start or have special bees bite crops on your farm, especially Honey Bees, Wasps, Tarantula Hawks, Bees, Petal Bees, and Queen Bees.

Sauce

3x Value

Drop the Spaghetti Sloth pet on your garden, and it might give you this mutation every 3 to 14 minutes.

Meatball

3x Value

Just like Sauce, Meatball can also be applied by the Spaghetti Sloth pet.

Pasta

4x Value

A Spaghetti Sloth can force it every 3 to 14 minutes , though it's rarer than the Sauce and Meatball mutations.

Burnt

4x Value

Use a Cooked Owl in your garden to turn your crops into the Burnt variant every 15.01 minutes. Players can also use the Burnt Mutation Spray to receive this mutation.

Silver

5x Value

Can grow randomly in your garden, like Gold and Rainbow, but can also be triggered with Silver Fertilizer from the Beanstalk Event or by activating all eight crystals in the Crystal Beams Event.

Verdant

5x Value

Hatch the Scarlet Macaw from the Paradise Egg and set it in your plot; every 11.57 minutes, there is a 15.78% chance it will activate this mutation. Or sprinkle the Mutation Spray Verdant over the fruits.

Clay

5x Value

Let your Wet fruits pick up the Sandy variant during Sandstorms to trigger the Clay Mutation.

Bloodlit

5x Value

When the Blood Moon weather hits the server, some of your plants might randomly gain the Bloodlit mutation. Using a Night Staff nearby can boost the chances.

Drenched

5x Value

While playing, the Tropical Rain weather may activate, turning the screen green and large droplets of water touch your crops, making them Drenched.

HoneyGlazed

5x Value

Set a Honey Sprinkler on your plot; itll work for a minute and turn your crops HoneyGlazed. Or drop a Bear Bee , which does the same every 25 minutes.

Heavenly

5x Value

Hop into the server during the Floating Jandel event (usually during Live Update launches), where a monkey rests mid-air and turns your crops Heavenly.

Plasma

5x Value

When the Lazer event happens, a giant monkey might target your plot with red laser beams, giving your crops the Plasma mutation.

Twisted

5x Value

If a Tornado Event starts while you're on the server, a tornado might sweep through your garden and apply this variant to a few crops.

Cloudtouched

5x Value

Sprinkle the Cloudtouched Mutation Spray on your fruits to get six Cloudtouched variants from a single item. Or throw in a Hyacinth Macaw ; it can turn them Cloudtouched too, though it only has a 15.74% chance every eight minutes.

Fried

8x Value

If the admins spawn the Fried Chicken event , fried chunks will fall on your plot, and a couple of fruits will become this version.

Static

8x Value

Use the Corrupted event's special Raiju fox in your garden, and itll automatically turn some plants into Static variants every 10.30 minutes.

Bloom

8x Value

Use the Mutation Spray Bloom to get this variant, or drop a Spriggan pet to apply this mutation to your fruits.

Frozen

10x Value

Once your fruits and veggies get the Wet mutation, hold off on picking them. When frost weather hits or a Polar Bear is active, those crops might turn into Frozen ones. You can also use a Frozen-mutated pet to get this variant.

Cooked

10x Value

You can only get this variant from a Cooked Owl . Leave it in your garden, and it has a 15.28% chance to randomly cook fruits. Its ability resets every 15.01 minutes, which you can reduce by aging it.

Amber

10x Value

Pour the Amber Mutation Spray on your fruits to get this variant. Alternatively, you can also use a Raptor . However, this pet usually only turns harvested fruits into Amber variants, so if youre aiming to stack the mutation, the spray is the better option.

Acidic

12x Value

When Acid Rain spawns naturally, it starts turning the server green. Any raindrops that fall on your plants will turn them Acidic.

Chakra

15x Value

Put a Kitsune in your garden, and itll turn someone elses fruit into this type and bring it to you.

CorruptChakra

15x Value

Only a Corrupted Kitsune can trigger this mutation on your fruits every 20.56 minutes, though there's only a 20.24% chance it will succeed.

Spaghetti

15x Value

Just keep your fruits hanging on the plants until they get the three food variants : Pasta, Sauce, and Meatball. Then, the plant will gain the Spaghetti mutation.

Aromatic

15x Value

Start the Kitchen Storm event by earning points in the Connoisseur event, which will trigger the Aromatic Wind effect on plants. Alternatively, you can get an Aromatic Pet Shard from the Rat Connoisseur rewards, apply it to any random critter, and itll begin turning your plants Aromatic.

Oil

15x Value

An exclusive Oil Rain weather will hit the server, soaking plants down to their roots with oil and turning them into this variant. Outside the event, you can still trigger this mutation using the Junkbot pet, which was specially gifted in update 1.18.0.

Boil

15x Value

Similar to Oil Rain, theres also Boil Rain weather . However, unlike Oil Rain, it can only be triggered by an admin, usually before the launch of updates. This weather can turn your fruits into this variant.

Eclipsed

15x Value

During the Solar Eclipse event , the server darkens, and players are alerted that certain fruits have absorbed this mutation.

Tempestuous

19x Value

Combine the Sandy, Twisted, and Windstruck mutations on a fruit to get this variant.

Golden

20x Value

This one is a luck-based mutation. Normally, you might see it appear on just one out of 100 plants, but you can increase your chances a bit by setting up tools like the Godly or Master Sprinkler , or by using variant pets like Praying Mantis or Pig . Planting a Super Seed or using a Dragonfly can also guarantee a gold variant plant.

Tranquil

20x Value

Use a Tanchozuru or Kodama in your plot, a Tranquil-mutated pet , or place a Tranquil Pet Shard to help other critters apply this mutation. You can also get lots of them during the Zen event (it goes live every 60 minutes in the game since the 1.15.0 update). Players can also use the Tranquil Staff to attract this mutation to special plants.

Corrupted

20x Value

Can be acquired during Corrupted Aura Weather in the Corrupted update, when cursed energy targets your fruits. You can also use a Corrupted Kodama, a Pet Shard Corrupted, and a Corrupt Staff to get these kinds of plants.

OldAmber

20x Value

After a full day (24 hours) with the Amber Mutation, your Amber plants will turn into OldAmber. This will remove the Amber multiplier and apply its new one instead.

Zombified

25x Value

Just drop a Chicken Zombie on your farmland, and itll grant some of your fruits this greenish mutation.

Molten

25x Value

Once the devs kick off the Volcano Event and giant molten chunks float into your garden, certain plants will pick up this mutation.

Ceramic

30x Value

It usually appears when your Clay fruits are stacked with the Burnt or Sundried mutation . You can also get this variant by combining Clay with Cooked, Molten, Fried, Meteoric, or Plasma mutations.

Harmonized Chakra

35x Value

Place a Kitsune and a Corrupted Kitsune on your farm, either together or one at a time, and let your fruits receive both Chakra and Corrupted Chakra mutations to become this exclusive Harmonized Chakra variant in Grow a Garden .

Junkshock

45x Value

A special Junkbot Raid weather event was triggered during the Albert admin abuse in update 1.18.0, where the sky was filled with Junkbots fighting each other, turning your fruits into this variant. Wait for this admin weather to get these fruits.

Rainbow

50x Value

This one can show up on its own, but its pretty rare. To get it faster, you can buy Super Seeds from the Premium Shop, use gear like Godly or Master Sprinklers , drop variant pets like Praying Mantis or Pig, or leave a Butterfly in your garden.

AncientAmber

50x Value

After 2 days , fruits with the OldAmber mutation will turn into AncientAmber, increasing their value 50 times. However, OldAmbers 20x multiplier will be removed.

Subzero

50x Value

Tornadoes start swirling through the plots during Route Runner weather , blessing your plants with the Subzero mutation.

Blitzshock

50x Value

Its a celebrity event where the Lightning Storm weather appears, triggered only by admins. During it, a lightning-filled football drops onto the ground, and fruits in your garden can get this mutation.

Sliced

50x Value

This mutation shows up during the Jandels Knives event when an admin spawns the Chef Monkey. Hell chop up the cooked chicken, and thats when your fruits can get the Sliced mutation.

Lightcycle

50x Value

When admins start the Stoplight event ( similar to Squid Games red light, green light ), a Blood Owl spawns on the server. You only need to be online during the event; participation isnt required to get this mutation.

Fortune

50x Value

While the Fortune mutation is unique to the Golden Egg plant from the Golden Goose , it can also be forced onto other fruits by selling the Golden Egg at Stevens Stall.

Friendbound

70x Value

It can randomly show up on your plants if you use more Friendship Pots in gardens linked with friends and keep your streaks going every day.

Infected

75x Value

During the Brains event (triggered by Jandel), let the spawned zombies infect your fruits with this variant.

Jackpot

77x Value

When an admin starts the Money Rain, and it drops on fruits, theyll get the Jackpot mutation.

Radioactive

80x Value

Once an admin spawns the Radioactive Carrot event , a giant rocket appears behind the Gear Shop. Keep loading it with carrots until it's ready to launch; after that, your plants will start getting this mutation.

Sundried

85x Value

Players can grab this variant when Heatwave Weather hits the server and sunbeams strike your crops. You can boost the likelihood by using a Tanning Mirror (available at the Gear Shop) near your desired crops to attract sunbeams.

FoxfireChakra

90x Value

You can only get this one with a Kitsune pet . Every 22 minutes, it has a small chance to turn a fruit into this variant for you.

CorruptFoxfireChakra

90x Value

Once a Corrupted Kitsune is in your plot, itll send energy balls to nine fruits every 20.56 minutes. Theres a very small chance that some of those fruits will receive this mutation.

Aurora

90x Value

At random in-game hours, the Aurora Borealis weather will light up the sky with northern lights, and during that time, your plants will gain the Aurora mutation.

Shocked

100x Value

You can get this mutation when lightning hits your crops during thunderstorm weather . Since the odds are low, its a good idea to place a Lightning Rod in your garden to help trigger it. You can also use a Shocked pet to grab these kinds of fruits.

Alienlike

100x Value

This is one of the admin-exclusive mutations that can show up on your fruits during the Alien Invasion Event when the UFO flying over the server affects the plants.

Paradisal

100x Value

If your crop gets both Verdant and Sundried mutations, it will shift into the Paradisal variant.

Celestial

120x Value

This variant can appear when a meteor hits your crops during Meteor Shower weather . To raise your chances, set a Star Caller in your plot; it helps attract falling stars.

Galactic

120x Value

During the Space Travel Event (triggered by an admin), the whole server will launch into space, and a few crops will gain this variant.

Disco

125x Value

Wait for an admin to start the Disco Event. During it, your avatar will dance, and some fruits in your garden will develop this bold, colorful mutation. You can also leave a Disco Bee to get this variant.

Meteoric

125x Value

Different from Celestial, this mutation also shows up during the Meteor Shower weather . Youll need to be online during that time to have a shot at getting it.

Touchdown

125x Value

During Post Dunk weather , Travis Kelce NPC appears gripping a portal, giving all gardens across the server an increased chance to grow the Touchdown variant.

Voidtouched

135x Value

When the Black Hole Event triggers (which only devs can activate), some of your fruits will become Voidtouched.

Dawnbound

150x Value

Once Jandel kicks off the Sun Event , gather four players, each holding a Sunflower, and show them to the Golden Monkey to trigger the mutation. Or just get the Ascended mutation on a pet ; this can randomly turn your fruits into Dawnbound every 5 to 6 hours.

HarmonisedFoxfireChakra

190x Value

Force both the FoxfireChakra and CorruptFoxfireChakra mutations onto a plant using the Kitsune and Corrupted Kitsune pets. Once applied, the plant will transform into this new supercharged mutation, but the original two mutations will be removed and cant be stacked again.

Grow a Garden's Stacked Mutations, Explained

Perhaps one of the coolest parts of Grow a Garden is how mutations can stack. That means a single plant can have more than one mutation at once. When that happens, its price can shoot up to billions and even trillions. To stack mutations in Grow a Garden, let your crops soak up more mutations during weather and events, or by using sprinklers and other items.

A Gold or Rainbow mutation adds a variant bonus to the fruit and can boost its value way more than fruits without it. Only one can show up on a fruit at a time, though. Aim for Rainbow if youre chasing more profit. Heres how wild the prices can get when mutations stack:

Best Stacked Mutations

Sell Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Sandy + Windstruck + Disco + Choc + Cloudtouched + Celestial + Static + Acidic+ Bloodlit + Moonlit + Zombified + Plasma + Pollinated + HoneyGlazed + Voidtouched + Heavenly + Radioactive + Dawnbound + Cooked + Ceramic + Molten + Infected + Tranquil + Jackpot + Subzero + Tempestuous + Galactic + Alienlike + Oil + Aromatic + Junkshock + Sundried + Aurora + Meteoric + AncientAmber + Touchdown+ HarmonisedFoxfireChakra + Eclipsed + Lightcycle + Fortune

106,950x Value

Rainbow + Voidtouched + Heavenly + Shocked + Frozen +Moonlit + Disco + Celestial + Choc + Bloodlit + Plasma + Pollinated + HoneyGlazed + Zombified + Plasma

26,800x Value

Rainbow + Disco + Celestial + Shocked + Frozen + Moonlit + Choc

17,700x Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Moonlit + Choc

5,550x Value

Rainbow + Shocked + Frozen + Choc or Moonlit

5,500x Value

Best Mutations in Grow a Garden

Here are some other top-tier variants you can go for daily if you're looking to farm a bunch of Sheckles:

  • HarmonisedFoxfireChakra gives the biggest multiplier to your fruits, but youll only get it if youve either hatched or traded for both a Kitsune and a Corrupted Kitsune.
  • Dawnbound is also one of the best mutations in Grow a Garden . Thankfully, after the Pets Mutations update, its no longer locked to just sunflowers; you can now make any critter Ascended and use it to grab Dawnbound fruits every day.
  • Celestial and Meteoric are both great picks for F2P players. They show up in Meteor Shower weather, though Celestial is a bit more common than Meteoric.
  • Disco is undoubtedly another profitable variant of GaG thats also easy to get. Just use Disco Bees to collect multiple of these every in-game day.
  • Shocked fruits are really valuable. Since theyre not tied to any event, they show up more frequently. All you need is some patience and a proper setup with a Lightning Rod to harvest a bunch daily.

Touchdown and Voidtouched are fantastic too, but they're tough to get since they rely on admins starting the events. So, this section lists the more accessible options instead.

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
Roblox
Game Creation System
Systems
427
8.8 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Released
September 1, 2006
ESRB
T for Teen
Developer(s)
Roblox Corporation
Publisher(s)
Roblox Corporation

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Powered by

item.title: Best Tactical JRPGs With Incredible Stories
item.description:
Summary

  • Tactical JRPGs often have long campaigns emulating war, with narratives focusing on warring kingdoms and evil rulers.
  • Disgaea 4 stands out with a silly yet compelling storyline featuring an Overlord who loves sardines.
  • Front Mission 4 offers a global political narrative with multiple perspectives, showing political greed hindering efforts to prevent war.

Tactical JRPGs can have some of the longest campaigns in the JRPG genre overall. Thats because they are trying to emulate war more so than a traditional turn-based or action JRPG, and war, of course, takes a long time. Many plots tend to follow similar tropes, like warring kingdoms, evil rulers, perhaps some magical dragons, and so on.

The following tactical JRPGs were different, though. They stood out when they were released, and they stand out now as expertly crafted narratives with heart, action, and maybe even some laughs. Maybe the gameplay wasnt always there, but the plots were gripping. Without going over spoilers, these are the best stories from tactical JRPGs, ranked based on the narratives alone.

8 Disgaea 4: A Promise Unforgotten

We Love Sardines

Disgaea 4: A Promise Unforgotten
8 /10
Released
February 24, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T // Animated Blood, Drug Reference, Fantasy Violence, Language, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Disgaea 4: A Promise Unforgotten boasts the franchise's best storyline, featuring one of the more complex would-be Overlords: Valvatorez. Voiced by Troy Baker before he became all-encompassing in video games, Valvatorez loves sardines, but he also yearns for revolution.

Together with his hodgepodge band of misfits, Valvatorez will retake the Underworld to make it better for everyone. Its a silly story overall, but one thats still compelling thanks to the well-written characters.

7 Jeanne d'Arc

A Bit Of History With Your Fantasy

Jeanne d'Arc
Tactical
Systems
Released
November 22, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T Due To Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Jeanne d'Arc is a fantastical retelling of the war between England and France between the 1300s and 1400s. Players assume the role of Jeanne, a stand-in for Joan of Arc, who cobbles together a small army to rebel against the humans and literal demons who burned her French village to the ground.

Characters like Jeanne receive magical equipment that allows them to temporarily transform into super-powered heroes to stop the tyranny. The historical backdrop gives Jeanne d'Arc an edge over other tactical JRPG stories, as bizarre as it is, thanks to the talent of Level-5s programmers and writers.

6 Front Mission 4

A Multinational Defense Mission

Front Mission 4
RPG
Tactical
Adventure
Systems
Released
June 15, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Front Mission 4 , like most entries in the series, gets into global politics with a world war set to explode at any minute. Players will build their team of Wanzer pilots, essentially mech pilots, to stop this war from happening.

The great thing about the story is seeing perspectives from multiple nations. Even when trying to prevent the world from blowing up, political greed gets in the way. By the end, players may see some justification in what the villains are trying to do.

5 Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor

Tokyo Beatdown

Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor
JRPG
Systems
Released
June 23, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Blood, Partial Nudity
Powered by

Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor is one of the more horrifying entries in the Megami Tensei series, as it isolates society from the normal world. All of a sudden, Japan is crawling with demons who are possessing some people and killing others.

Factions break out all over, and players, as a nameless high schooler, have the power to change Japan thanks to their demon-summoning ability. The difficulty level keeps things tense, making for a compelling horror story set between fiction and reality.

4 Fire Emblem Fates

Two Sides To Every Story

Fire Emblem Fates
9.0 /10
Released
February 19, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Animated Blood, Fantasy Violence, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Fire Emblem Fates had a Pokemon -like approach to its launch, with two versions available to purchase. Corrin, who could be male or female, was the protagonist no matter what. They were born in the kingdom of Hoshido in Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright , while Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest was about Corrin being raised by the kingdom of Nohr through adoption.

Both Fire Emblem Fates stories are riveting to play through, and they raise the dilemma of blood relatives versus found families. Also, a third act was eventually released, Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation , which put a new perspective on these warring families.

3 Valkyria Chronicles 3

Suicide Squad

Valkyria Chronicles III
RPG
Tactical
Systems
Released
January 27, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Valkyria Chronicles 3 has the best story in the franchise, and most JRPG players may have never touched it. Thats because it was only released for the PSP in Japan, but dedicated fans have translated it to the best of their abilities.

What makes the games story compelling is the premise, as a group of soldiers called The Nameless are thrown into difficult situations and expected to get the job done no matter what. Their superiors care only for victory and not the health of Squad 422. Meanwhile, the members of Squad 422 still have a yearning to live, and the only way they can do that is through cooperation and determination.

2 Triangle Strategy

Salt Wars

Triangle Strategy
RPG
Tactical
Systems
Released
March 4, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Triangle Strategy is one of the few tactical JRPGs that gives players a compelling reason to replay it multiple times. There are many branching paths, and each one will introduce a new party member to Triangle Strategys team composition, which can change the whole dynamic of combat.

The overall plot focuses on a passive nation caught in the middle of a war over salt between several kingdoms. While the beginning is slow, each new political upheaval and revelation will keep players hooked on the game until the credits roll.

1 Final Fantasy Tactics

Religious And Family Corruption

Final Fantasy Tactics
Tactical
RPG
Systems
14
8.9 /10
Released
June 20, 1997
ESRB
t

Powered by

Final Fantasy Tactics is going to be at the top of a lot of lists when it comes to topics about tactical RPGs. It was released in 1998, and decades later, fans still love it. For Final Fantasy , the story was more mature than others at the time, even Final Fantasy 7 . There was blood, religious cults, political back-stabbings, and a whole cavalcade of lore-rich characters.

The linearity of the narrative, beyond some flashback chapters, helped keep things focused. The PSP versions English script was better translated than the PS1 original, which should be further tweaked in the remake, Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, for all to enjoy soon enough.

item.title: Battlefield 2042 Player Count is Way Up
item.description:
Battlefield 2042 is seeing a major spike in daily users on Steam, likely thanks to a surprise update adding a lot of free content for players jumping back in. Battlefield 6' s second, and so far final, open beta weekend has come to an end, with DICE incentivizing players who miss the game to jump back into Battlefield 2042 .

Battlefield 2042 has still been getting monthly updates, though most have focused on reworking existing content, and some may say there is room for improvement in later Battlefield games. A few years after the game's rocky launch, it has rarely broken 10,000 concurrent players on Steam during recent months.

Exclusive Battlefield 6 Rewards Boost Battlefield 2042's Player Count

As of August 18, update 9.2 is live, giving players tons of new content to engage with, boosting Battlefield 2042 's peak Steam users to over 20,000 for the first time in almost a year. On top of new weapons and vehicles to use, all players have access to 60 tiers of a free battle pass, giving rewards for Battlefield 2042 , and some that can be redeemed in Battlefield 6 once the game launches. Lots of the cosmetics added with this new update come from previous Battlefield games, giving returning fans all the more reason to pick up Battlefield 2042 while they wait for the release of Battlefield 6 .

This boost in player count can only be measured on Steam, and it can be guessed that all other platforms are seeing a similar boost, as those riding the high from the Battlefield 6 beta are looking for something to do until the game's full release on October 10. The free battle pass in Battlefield 2042 is live now, and players have until October 7 to get through as many ranks as possible and get themselves even more ready for Battlefield 6 .

The Battlefield 6 rewards in this battle pass are exclusive, and DICE has confirmed that they won't be obtainable any other way. The exact details of how these rewards will be redeemed between games haven't been directly stated, though it may require a linked EA account or through one's system's account.

DICE has put in a lot of effort since launch to keep adding new and exciting content into the game, like collaborating with popular IPs such as Mass Effect . Players who haven't touched the game since launch years ago may be pleasantly surprised if they jump in now to find the game playing very differently.

6 Images
6 Images

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Grow a Garden: All Pets & What They Do
item.description:
Grow a Garden has given players a super-cozy and chill Roblox experience thats charmed them from the start. But farming can get a little too quiet without some company, especially if you dont have many in-game friends. Thankfully, the 1.04.0 update introduced pets as sidekicks, making the game a lot more fun and heartwarming.

While these little creatures brighten up your farm and bring it to life, they also support you in many incredible ways. For those interested, this guide will give you a detailed rundown of all Grow a Garden pets and their abilities.

Updated on August 18, 2025, by Somiya Adrees: With each Grow a Garden update, new critters join the ever-growing pet lineup. This guide has been updated to include all pets added up to the 1.19.0 update. New sections have also been added, covering how to collect pets and improve their performance.

How to Get Pets in Grow a Garden

Players can collect so many adorable pets in the game, though only 60 of them can be stored at a time (unless youve bought extra pet storage), and just a few can be actively used on the farm. The main way to get pets in Grow a Garden is by opening Pet Eggs, which are available through Raphaels Stall or special event shops.

If you're new, Raphaels Stall (called Pet Eggs) is located near the Gear Shop. There, you can purchase six types of eggs, each hatching pets of different rarities. Just keep in mind that only three random types are stocked at any given time. Here's what you might find:

Pet Eggs

Pets Rarity

Cost

Hatch Time

Availability in Beanstalk Update

Common Egg

Common

50,000 Sheckles

10 minutes

Yes

Common Summer Egg

Common

1,000,000 Sheckles

20 minutes

Yes

Uncommon Egg

Uncommon

150,000 Sheckles

20 minutes

No

Rare Egg

Rare

600,000 Sheckles

2 hours

No

Rare Summer Egg

Rare

25,000,000 Sheckles

4 hours

Yes

Legendary Egg

Legendary

3,000,000 Sheckles

3 hours

No

Mythical Egg

Mythical

8,000,000 Sheckles

5 hours, 7 minutes

Yes

Bee Egg

Mythical

30,000,000 Sheckles

4 hours and 10 minutes

Yes (only from Honey Traveling Merchant)

Paradise Egg

Mythical

50,000,000 Sheckles

6 hours and 40 minutes

Yes

Bug Egg

Divine

50,000,000 Sheckles

8 hours

Yes

While the aforementioned eggs can be obtained anytime, event-exclusive eggs, like the Oasis Egg, Primal Egg or Zen Egg, only show up during events. You can grab them from event shops or sometimes in the Game Shop. With the new crafting mechanic, players can also create an Anti Bee Egg at the Crafting Table using resources. Once you have an egg, simply place it in your garden and wait for it to hatch. If youre in a hurry, you can speed things up using Robux or pets that help hatch eggs faster.

Remember, the devs often give out free new pets, like the Chicken Zombie, Cooked Owl or Football, to players who attend the live launch of the latest updates, so try not to miss them.

What Do Pets Do in Grow a Garden?

Pets in GaG arent your average buddies you feed and care for to get good vibes. They do real work for you, like bringing free seeds, gear, mutation tools, Sheckles, and a lot more. There are seven rarities of animals in the game, with the unique ones offering better perks. Here's a breakdown of all the critters and their individual traits in the game.

All Common Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Common Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Bunny

Eats a carrot (normal or chocolate variant) and increases its selling value by 1.53x or more when it ages.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Dog

Tries to dig up a seed from your garden (Seed Shop ones) every minute. The seed isn't guaranteed, though, with a success rate of 5.14%.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Golden Lab

Works like the Dog but has a better shot at finding a seed , with a success rate of about 10.31%.

33.33% from the Common Egg

Starfish

Wanders in the garden and gains 6.36 experience points , making it grow older. Best for opening pet slots.

50% from the Common Summer Egg

Crab

Walks up to another player on the server every 6.12 minutes and pinches them to snag around 260 to 460 Sheckles . They dont lose any money.

25% from the Common Summer Egg

Seagull

Gives you a free seed of the plant you just shoveled (flowers and veggies only), though the chance is just 3.53%. The seagull doesnt work on fruit crops like Mango, Moon Mango, Pineapple, Banana, and others.

25% from the Common Summer Egg

Bagel Bunny

Works like a normal bunny but increases your carrot's value by 5x by eating it every 4 to 45 seconds.

50% from the Gourmet Egg

Dairy Cow

Your planted crops grow 1.28x faster within 10.23 studs. Selling this critter has a small chance to reward you with a Beanstalk Seed .

50% from the Sprout Egg

All Uncommon Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Uncommon Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Black Bunny

Raises the price of carrots (or chocolate carrots) by 1.53 times when consumed, doing it just a bit sooner than a regular bunny.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Cat

Naps for 10.12 seconds every 1 minute and 20 seconds, making nearby fruits (within 10.12 studs) grow 1.25x bigger .

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Chicken

Increases egg hatch speed by 10.36%.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Deer

Has a 2.53% chance of making berry fruits stay on the plant even after harvesting. Berry fruits include Celestiberry, Strawberry, Blueberry, Cranberry, and Raspberry.

25% from the Uncommon Egg

Bee

Goes to a random fruit or veggie every 24 minutes and 45 seconds and makes it Pollinated .

65% from the Bee Egg

Shiba Inu

Finds a seed every minute with a 15% chance; its ability improves with age.

40% from the Zen Egg

Maneki-neko

Gives you an 8.15% chance to refund your sold fruits every 2.22 minutes. The cats trait lasts only 10.25 seconds, and the odds are even lower for rare fruits.

None (Obtainable from the Zen Shop)

Bacon Pig

A nice swap for the Pig; it gives about 2.01x better chances for Gold and Rainbow variants every two minutes in a 15.20-stud range.

34.5% from the Culinarian Chest

Sunny-Side Chicken

Always sits on an egg and shortens hatching time by 20.22%.

None (Obtainable from the Rat Connoisseur's Rewards)

Jackalope

Thumps its feet every 99.48 seconds, forcing the Sandy mutation (3x value) on a nearby plant (15.52% chance).

31% from the Sprout Egg

All Rare Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Rare Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Orange Tabby

A better version of the cat. It sleeps for about 1.30 minutes and makes fruits within 15.16 studs become larger by 1.51% during that time.

33.33% from the Rare Egg

Spotted Deer

Like the deers trait, but boosts the chance of berry fruits remaining on the plant after picking to around 5.10%.

16.67% from the Rare Egg

Rooster

Raises egg hatch speed by 20.93%.

10% from the Rare Egg

Pig

Has a chance to turn nearby fruits within 15 studs into Gold and Rainbow variants . The likelihood of this occurring is just 2.02%, and the ability lasts for only 15.35 seconds every two minutes.

25% from the Rare Egg

Monkey

Refunds fruits when selling (only 2.55% likelihood). Rare fruits like Beanstalk, Candy Blossom, Moon Mango, and more have a small chance of a return.

4% from the Rare Egg

Kiwi

Finds and sits on the egg with the highest hatch time every minute, reducing its hatch time by 20.24%.

None (Obtainable by completing Lunar Quest)

Hedgehog

Makes prickly fruits 1.52 times larger. In Grow a Garden , prickly fruits include Cactus, Durian, Dragon Fruit, and Pineapple.

47% from the Night Egg

Honey Bee

Triggers the Pollinated mutation on plants every 19.43 minutes.

25% from the Bee Egg

Wasp

Turns a random fruit Pollinated every 29.46 minutes, then bites and raises an active pet's cooldown by almost a minute every 9.58 minutes.

55% from the Anti Bee Egg

Flamingo

Increases crop growth speed (both seeds and fully grown) for about 15 minutes by standing on a leg every 3.57 minutes. Its ability only affects crops within a range of 13.45 studs.

30% from the Rare Summer Egg

Toucan

Turns your tropical plants bigger and gives them a mutation within a 25.77-stud range. The chances are 1.70x for size and 1.18x for mutation. In Grow a Garden , Tropical plants include Coconut, Mango, Dragon Fruit, Watermelon, Cacao, and more.

25% from the Rare Summer Egg

Sea Turtle

Waters a fruit every 1.97 minutes, giving it a 10.10% chance of transforming into a Wet variant (2x value). Also helps age a random pet every 10.52 minutes, granting it 1,004.77 EXP.

20% from the Rare Summer Egg

Orangutan

Useful for crafting sprays, seeds, sprinklers, and other tools, as it gives you a small chance to get some crafting materials back in your backpack once activated.

15% from the Rare Summer Egg

Seal

When you sell a pet, there's a 2.24% chance you'll get its egg back in your inventory. For example, selling a Mouse might give you a Mythical Egg.

10% from the Rare Summer Egg

Nihonzaru

Once you place a Hot Spring in your garden (purchasable from the Zen Shop), this pet will bathe in it and enhance the traits of all active pets.

31% from the Zen Egg

Pancake Mole

Better than a Mole, it digs every 10 to 80 seconds and can pull up all kinds of sprinklers (even Master and Grandmaster), Sheckles, or useful tools like the Recall Wrench, Harvest Tool, Lightning Rod, or Watering Can.

38% from the Gourmet Egg

All Legendary Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Legendary Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Cow

Speeds up the growth of all plants within 8.18 studs by 1.12%, making their fruits spawn faster than usual.

42.55% from the Legendary Egg

Silver Monkey

Can return your fruits and veggies after selling them, but the probability is only 7.76%.

42.55% from the Legendary Egg

Sea Otter

Acts like a living watering can. It sprays water on random plants every 15 seconds, helping their fruits grow faster.

10.64% from the Legendary Egg

Polar Bear

May grant a Chilled or Frozen mutation to random fruits every 1.29 minutes, though the likelihood is just 10.14%.

2.13% from the Legendary Egg

Turtle

Helps sprinklers (Basic, Advanced, Godly, Master, and Chocolate) last 20.47% longer.

2.13% from the Legendary Egg

Panda

Jumps over and eats bamboo , increasing its selling value by 1.57x.

None (Animal Update Pet)

Blood Hedgehog

Makes prickly fruits 2.02% bigger, and any mutated ones among them sell for 1.16% more.

None (Obtainable from the Blood Moon Shop)

Blood Kiwi

Increases both the hatch time and hatch speed of eggs in your garden by 45.56% and 20.25%, respectively.

None (Obtainable from the Blood Moon Shop)

Mole

Around every 1.20 minutes, it digs up gear or Sheckles for you. Gear includes a Trowel, Lightning Rod, Watering Can, all Sprinklers, and anything from the Gear Shop.

23.5% from the Night Egg

Frog

Makes a random crop grow faster for a full 24 hours, meaning its fruits ripen quicker. This ability activates every 19.48 minutes.

17.63% from the Night Egg

Moon Cat

Snoozes for 20.18 seconds every minute and enlarges fruits by 1.51x within a small range. It also helps Moon-type fruits (Moon Mango, Moon Blossom, Moonflower, etc.) stay on the plant after picking.

None (Obtainable from the Twilight Shop)

Firefly

Gives you a Shocked veggie or fruit every 1.32 minutes (3.07% success rate).

None (Test exclusive)

Petal Bee

Not only does it make your flower plants not disappear after picking (1.13% chance), but it also gives a crop the Pollinated mutation after a round of 24.49 minutes.

4% from the Bee Egg

Tarantula Hawk

Works like a Wasp, but quicker. This hawk can mutate a plant in 24.39 minutes and improves cooldown by 82.01 seconds.

30% from the Anti Bee Egg

Moth

Fills the Hunger Bar of an active pet completely every 12.55 minutes.

13.75 from the Anti Bee Egg

Ostrich

Gives newly hatched critters an age bonus , starting them anywhere between 1 and 4.49.

40% from the Paradise Egg

Peacock

Fans its beautiful feathers to reduce the cooldown of pets hanging around it by 60.78 seconds every 9.58 minutes.

30% from the Paradise Egg

Capybara

Nearby pets (within 15.65 studs) wont lose hunger and build up 3.65 experience points every second.

21% from the Paradise Egg

Scarlet Macaw

Has a 15.95% chance of mutating your fruit into a Verdant variant (4x value) every 11.50 minutes.

8% from the Paradise Egg

Meerkat

Checks out a pet in your garden and reduces its ability cooldow n by 21.08 seconds every 7.14 minutes. Theres also a 15.54% chance it will do it again right after.

45% from the Oasis Egg

Sand Snake

Lets you snag an extra seed or tool when buying one from the Seed Shop or Gear Shop.

34.5% from the Oasis Egg

Bald Eagle

This eagle speeds up the hatching time of all eggs in your garden by 70 seconds every 7 minutes. There's a 70% chance it doubles that, making the hatch time go faster by around 140 seconds instead.

None (Obtainable from the 4th of July Shop)

Raptor

Can magically give your picked fruits the Amber Mutation (10x Multiplier) with only a 2.28% probability. But if your harvested plants are rare, the chance is even lower. Also, it makes you walk faster by 14.35% on the server.

35% from the Dinosaur Egg

Triceratops

Increases the growth of three plants every 3.33 minutes by 33.33 milliliters. You have a 15.18% chance it might do the same for three more plants.

32.5% from the Dinosaur Egg

Stegosaurus

Blesses you with a 9.13% chance for your harvested fruits to be duplicated . Common fruits like strawberries and blueberries easily double, but rare ones like Sunflower, Elephant Egg, and Beanstalk might not be an easy catch. If you try grabbing Prehistoric fruits like the Ancient Seed Pack ones, or even Burning Bud or Bone Blossom, those have a higher likelihood of doubling.

28% from the Dinosaur Egg

Pterodactyl

Gives between three and four fruits the Windstruck Mutation (2x Multiplier) every 10.54 minutes. If youre lucky, one of your fruits also gets the Twisted Mutation (5x Multiplier), though the chance is just 18.68%. Also increases your jump height by 14.48%.

3% from the Dinosaur Egg

Parasaurolophus

Cuts down 81.21 seconds from the Cosmetic Crate with the longest timer every 1 minute 18.71 seconds. There's a 25.96% chance that it shortens the opening time even more.

35% from the Primal Egg

Iguanodon

All Dino pets (especially from Dinosaur Egg and Primal Egg) walking around your farm earn 0.45 XP per second .

32.5% from the Primal Egg

Pachycephalosaurus

There's a 6.52% chance you'll get a duplicate item while crafting at the Crafting Tables.

28% from the Primal Egg

Tanuki

Causes drama in your garden by occasionally turning your fruits into Choc (2x), Chilled (2x), Moonlit (2x), Bloodlit (5x), or other versions; and also increasing your money, its own XP, or other pets passives.

20.82% from the Zen Egg

Tanchozuru

Meditates for 10.22 seconds every 10.24 minutes, giving nearby crops a 15.11% chance to gain the Tranquil Mutation .

4.6% from the Zen Egg

Football

Every 87 seconds, it runs to either the Gear Shop or the Seec Shop (whichever is farther from your plot) to bring you a Watering Can (20.40% chance) or 870 Sheckles.

None (Corrupted Update Pet)

Kodama

Blesses your Zen fruits (including Zen Seed Packs) with a 4.26% chance to gain a Tranquil mutation (20x) after being harvested from the plant.

Kitsune Chest

Corrupted Kodama

This pet has a 4.22% chance to turn your fruits into Corrupted fruits (20x), which are needed for the Corrupted quest.

None (Obtainable by completing the Corrupted Quest)

Sushi Bear

Can apply Frozen (10x value) or Chilled (2x value) mutations to plants every 10 to 80 seconds (with only a 15% chance). It also runs out roughly every 2 to 11 minutes to fill a random pet's hunger bar by 1 to 50%.

7% from the Gourmet Egg

Hotdog Daschund

Its a food pet that throws either a mustard or ketchup puddle every 3.57 seconds, with a 20.70% chance of boosting cooldown or experience points.

14.5% from the Culinarian Chest

Gorilla Chef

Jumps over a Cooking Pot in the garden, stirs, and cooks to give you duplicate food in your inventory after you finish making meals in the Connoisseur event (5.19% chance). Youll need to win and place a Cooking Pot to trigger this ability.

None (Obtainable from the Rat Connoisseur's Rewards)

Seedling

It enters one of your plots and picks two plants to swap mutations around every five minutes. The good thing is, it leaves favorited plants alone.

12% from the Sprout Egg

All Mythical Pet Abilities in Grow a Garden

Mythical Pets

Traits and Abilities

Drop Odds

Grey Mouse

Gives the Mouse 521.75 EXP every 10 minutes and boosts players' jump height.

35.71% from the Mythical Egg

Brown Mouse

Allows players to jump higher. Gains 803.74 EXP every eight minutes, aging relatively quickly.

26.79% from the Mythical Egg

Squirrel

Stops a 'Use' from being consumed when using the Reclaimer. Also, it gets experience points every second and ages quickly.

26.79% from the Mythical Egg

Red Giant Ant

With this animal, theres a 5.16% chance that picking normal fruits (especially berries) gives you an extra one in your inventory.

8.93% from the Mythical Egg

Red Fox

Hops into your neighbors garden every 8.57 minutes and tries to grab a seed from any of their non-event plants to bring you. Red Foxes have quite a low success rate if the garden has high-rarity seeds.

1.79% from the Mythical Egg

Caterpillar

Leafy plants within its range produce fruits faster. Leafy plants are those with green leaves, such as Beanstalk, Grape, Eggplant, Pepper, etc.

40% from the Bug Egg

Snail

You might get a seed from the crop you just harvested (5.08% likelihood).

30% from the Bug Egg

Giant Ant

When harvesting crops, there's a 10.38% possibility that theyll be cloned , giving you two fruits instead of one. Although rare plants are less likely to duplicate, candy fruits are more likely.

25% from the Bug Egg

Echo Frog

Nearly every 15 minutes, one of your crops will experience faster growth for an entire real-world day. The crop will give fruits more rapidly than usual.

8.23% from the Night Egg

Praying Mantis

Prays for 10.30 seconds every 1.32 minutes, increasing your chance of finding a mutated fruit on its radar. You can get any normal mutation except event ones or those triggered by devs (i.e., Plasma and Dawnbound).

4% from the Bug Egg

Owl

All walking critters in your garden gain 0.23 EXP every second. This is helpful in aging them and then selling them to unlock extra pet slots.

None (Obtainable by completing Lunar Quest)

Chicken Zombie

You might get a Zombified fruit every 30 seconds (with only a 20.30% chance). Egg hatch speed also increases by 10.15%.

None (Blood Moon Update Pet)

Hamster

Runs on a hamster wheel every 3.05 minutes and boosts the crafting speed for items you're making at the Crafting Tables by 30.45% for 18.74 seconds.

None (Obtainable from the Summer Shop)

Bear Bee

Grants a nearby fruit, the HoneyGlazed mutation , every 25 minutes.

5% from the Bee Egg

Butterfly

Finds a plant with five or more mutations every 29.56 minutes and replaces all existing variants with the Rainbow mutation . She doesnt touch favorited plants.

1% from the Anti Bee Egg

Pack Bee

Once placed on your plot, it increases your inventory size by 26.40.

None (Obtainable from the Crafting Tables)

Cooked Owl

Can You Improve Pet Traits in Grow a Garden?

You can definitely improve your pet's ability in Grow a Garden by either aging it or giving it Gold and Rainbow mutations . By doing so, theyll experience a spike in their ability. For example, they'll be able to duplicate fruits more successfully, use their traits more often, and even have a higher likelihood of giving variants or seeds.

To age your pets faster, make sure theyre well-fed and gaining EXP by roaming freely or with the help of EXP-boosting animals. The best part is, just like crops, pets continue to grow while you're offline. You just need to keep an eye on their hunger bar, which decreases every 12 hours. As for Gold and Rainbow mutations, they are luck-based. Just toss a pet (aged 50 or older) into the Pet Mutation machine and hope it comes out like that.

Players can also use the Pet Mutations machine to give pets other powers , like adding mutations to fruits, stopping fruit from getting stolen, or giving experience points to active critters.

Do Pet Abilities Stack in Grow a Garden?

Based on Grow a Gardens official Discord, pet abilities do stack. This means you can get more from their combined traits. For instance, a Polar Bear only gives a small chance for Chilled or Frozen fruits to spawn on your farm, but having more of these critters can raise your mutation odds. Also, since the Silver Monkey has trouble refunding unique plants, you can leave many of those on your plot if you want to keep your valuable crops even after selling them.

This stacking works for animals with similar traits, too. Having an Owl, Night Owl, and Blood Owl together can give your active pets experience points a nice boost. To get the most out of this, try unlocking more pet slots (there are up to eight) and add critters that meet your goals.
